title: A 9-year-old boy is killed in a rocket attack in southern Ukraine.
Renewed Shelling Puts Nuclear Plant at Risk Despite U.N. Presence
description: The International Atomic Energy Agency was still cautiously optimistic that “permanently” stationing two experts at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant would help avert disaster.

title: The Biden administration asks Congress for $13.7 billion in additional aid for Ukraine, underscoring its resolve.
E.U. Says It Can Endure Winter Without Russian Gas Supply
description: The European Union economy minister said the bloc was “well prepared” to resist efforts by Moscow to disrupt its energy supply.

title: Chile Votes on Constitution That Would Enshrine Record Number of Rights
description: In a single ballot on Sunday, Chileans will decide on abortion, universal health care, rights for nature and a record expansion of constitutional rights.

title: Shabab Attack Trucks Carrying Food Relief in Somalia
description: The attack in central Somalia comes even as the country faces a devastating drought that has left almost half its population hungry.

title: Game On
description: It’s Labor Day weekend, the perfect time to try — you guessed it — pickleball.

title: How Many Drinks a Week Are Safe? Canada Considers a Much Lower Limit
description: Research to update Canada’s drinking guideline has found that there are no health benefits, only dangers, from alcohol.

title: As Britain Prepares for a New Leader, Tensions With Allies Loom
description: Comments from the front-runner for prime minister, Liz Truss, suggest bumpier relations with Europe and the U.S. if she wins, with Northern Ireland getting in the way of the “special relationship.”

title: High Seas Deception: How Shady Ships Use GPS to Evade International Law
description: A technology enabling the transmission of fake locations to carry out murky or even illegal business operations could have profound implications for the enforcement of international law.

title: How Shady Ships Use GPS to Evade International Law
description: A technology enabling the transmission of fake locations to carry out murky or even illegal business operations could have profound implications for the enforcement of international law.

title: Post-Roe Decision, Abortion Pill Providers Work to Broaden Access
description: These new efforts, which test the legal boundaries, have sprung up since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade and many states restricted abortion.

title: Gorbachev’s Funeral Begins in Moscow, With Putin Conspicuously Absent
description: Befitting his legacy, the ceremony for Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the last Soviet leader, avoided the aplomb of a grand state occasion.

title: U.N. Will Keep Two Experts at Embattled Nuclear Plant
description: Russia and Ukraine have blamed each other for shelling at the Zaporizhzhia station, where some inspectors have been assessing damage and risks.

title: A price cap on Russian oil wins the backing of G7 ministers.
Sri Lanka’s Rajapaksa Returns Home, Just Weeks After Being Ousted
description: The former president’s dramatic fall from grace had seemed to end a powerful dynasty, but his arrival in Colombo shows how deeply entrenched his family is.

title: Ukraine Struggles to Identify Bucha Massacre Victims, Five Months On
description: No longer able to defer burial, Ukrainian investigators are photographing unclaimed and unidentified bodies, taking DNA samples and assigning them numbers, hoping that one day their families will claim them.

title: Explosion Kills 8 Police Officers in Colombia
description: Dozens of police officers have been killed in the country so far this year, as its new president struggles to quell a wave of violence he campaigned on ending.
